title: Reflective Practice and Reasoning Strategies for Digital Learning Environment Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and foundational social science knowledge
context.additional_context: A blended reality learning process using learners’ personal devices, involving the design of digital learning projects to solve real-world social problems.

learning_goals: Learners can flexibly respond to learner needs through real-time reflective practice (reflection-in-action) when designing digital learning environments
Learners can predict various learning scenarios and derive optimal design solutions using conjecturing strategies
Learners can generate external representations using simulation/VR-based tools and systematically evaluate the learning design process
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
